name: places/ChIJRRTNDYlZwokRV_3edoIopHo
formattedAddress: 430 Broome St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 430 Broome St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cool venue for Vinyasa classes set to hip-hop & popular music, plus private & small-group sessions.

originalText.text: Was visiting from out of town and really enjoyed my class here. The vibe is awesome, instructor’s cuing was excellent, and infrared heat is definitely my favorite source of warmth for yoga. If you’re in town and have time to kill, this is a great way to do it.

text.text: Was visiting from out of town and really enjoyed my class here. The vibe is awesome, instructor’s cuing was excellent, and infrared heat is definitely my favorite source of warmth for yoga. If you’re in town and have time to kill, this is a great way to do it.

originalText.text: I just did Jennifer's Sunday Hip Hop class at the Soho studio. It was soo good! The routine was challenging, and I felt like I worked hard. I left the class feeling strong, sweaty and rejuvenated. The music was also really good. I will definitely keep going back, and I recommend that you go to Jennifer's classes - she was the best!!

text.text: I just did Jennifer's Sunday Hip Hop class at the Soho studio. It was soo good! The routine was challenging, and I felt like I worked hard. I left the class feeling strong, sweaty and rejuvenated. The music was also really good. I will definitely keep going back, and I recommend that you go to Jennifer's classes - she was the best!!

originalText.text: I really love the Y7 concept and classes but would not recommend this location as I’ve had poor experiences with the staff each time I’ve been here. However, if you’re looking for yoga in SoHo, this isn’t a bad option. When you arrive to the door, you need to ring the doorbell to be let in. There’s one shower, one non-shower stall and two changing curtains. Mats and towel mats are available for rent. If you’re doing one of the first heated classes, I would recommend not buying a towel mat as the room doesn’t get warm quickly enough to warrant the rental fee.

originalText.text: I love this class but they literally made me cry today. After a long day I was excited to visit Y7 Soho. I knew they had a strict policy on not being late, so I got there fairly early. This studio has no flag, very little signage outside and then a buzzer to get in for which you need a code. So, it's difficult to find. I paced outside for several minutes trying to find it and as a resort went to call the studio only to find they had NO PHONE NUMBER. When I finally found my way in, they didn't let me into the class despite the fact I brought them two new customers (friends) who I had introduced to the studio for the first time. I gave the feedback they should really have a phone number and they said sorry you can I my reach us via email!? Then get a banner. Honestly, it's 2018 I should be able to call you in a click.

originalText.text: I love y7! Studio is a bit small so wouldn’t plan on getting changed there, but the instructors are great. I love the loud music and dark room for the hot yoga.

text.text: I love y7! Studio is a bit small so wouldn’t plan on getting changed there, but the instructors are great. I love the loud music and dark room for the hot yoga.
